column4: hey guys ... i have succesfully established a vpn connection to my university. know i wants to gets routed all traffic throught that tunnel ... but how do i define the route?
# man route
thanks for the tip ... but my question wasn't how to open the manpage ...
i know the man page will yell you how to define the route
type route show, see the * thats the default gateway just change that to what ever the gateway is on your VPN
its via pptp ...
i see... D'Oh
i cant remember if there's a way to change the "default" interface

u are too fast for me. i have a normal internet connection (with a router) at home. but know, i want to connect to my university via pptp (i got i running with a new device ppp0). so, the last step is to route all traffic over ppp0 ... a already add a new gw but it didn't changed anything ...
2 sec
dont hurry, be happy :)
hehe i am happy ;)
but anyway, what you need to do
theres a way to set the default INTERFACE using route
i cant remember what command that is
problem is that when i change the default route i kill my ptpp connection because it runs over the old route.
thats a pain in the ass im must admit, maybe use a firewall to redirect traffic?
FYI i'm reading about default routes, pptp apparently creates its own default route so it *should* automatically go over the VPN

but i does not ... i am using no proxy and i still have to same ip address ... i should have one of the university ones ... i am sure the tunnel gets created. no errors at all and i can ping one of our internal university servers.
does your Uni have proxy servers
sure
try using one of their proxy servers
your uni's that is
instead of using vpn/pptp?
